definition: A high-ranking military official who holds the highest command authority over armed forces, typically responsible for making strategic decisions and overseeing military operations. This term is commonly used to refer to the individual in charge of overall command and control of a nation's military forces.

examples.german: Der Oberbefehlshaber hat die Kontrolle über alle Truppen
examples.english: The supreme commander has control over all troops

examples.german: Der Oberbefehlshaber wurde zum General befördert
examples.english: The commander-in-chief was promoted to general

examples.german: Der Oberbefehlshaber leitet die militärischen Operationen
examples.english: The supreme commander directs the military operations

examples.german: Der Oberbefehlshaber hat das letzte Wort in strategischen Entscheidungen
examples.english: The commander-in-chief has the final say in strategic decisions
